thread.title: Man who threatened coworker with landmine being held without bail - Massachusetts news
thread.title_full: Man who threatened coworker with landmine being held without bail - Massachusetts news

author: boston.com
title: Man who threatened coworker with landmine being held without bail - Massachusetts news
text:
The man who brought an inert mine to his workplace Wednesday morning is currently being held without bail after he was arraigned in Quincy District Court Thursday, according to David Traub of the Norfolk District Attorney’s office.
Bruce Beck was arrested and charged with possession of a hoax device, assault by means with a dangerous weapon, and receiving stolen property over $250, after he threatened a coworker with another inert landmine.
Related Link Police: Man threatened coworker with ‘inert’ mine When authorities searched Beck’s Plainville home, they found another claymore mine, according to Quincy Police. Authorities said that Beck took the devices from the U.S. Army, where he served in active duty for four years, and in the reserves for 16 years, according to The Boston Globe .
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Beck pled not guilty, Traub said, and will be back in court for a dangerousness hearing on October 9.
